meanings.definition: A brief period of time during which an activity is stopped or paused.
meanings.sent1: During the timeout, the game was put on hold.
meanings.sent2: She needed a timeout from work to relax and recharge.
meanings.sent3: Taking a timeout from studying to grab a snack can be refreshing.
meanings.sent4: The timeout in the music added suspense to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The timeout between each round allowed the players to strategize.

meanings.definition: A disciplinary action in which a person is temporarily removed from a situation or activity.
meanings.sent1: The child was given a timeout for misbehaving in class.
meanings.sent2: The coach enforced a timeout for the player's unsportsmanlike conduct.
meanings.sent3: Being put in timeout made the student realize the importance of following rules.
meanings.sent4: The timeout served as a wake-up call for the employee to improve their behavior.
meanings.sent5: The timeout helped the individual reflect on their actions and make amends.
